title: Final Knowledge Test - ICTSAS305
description: Comprehensive assessment covering all three elements of providing ICT advice to clients.

questions.text: When reviewing client support issues, what is the benefit of checking previous logs?

answers.text: To assign blame for recurring issues
To find proven solutions and identify patterns

questions.text: Effective client communication requires using clear, ___ language.
What must be documented when investigating a support issue?

answers.text: Steps taken, root cause, solution, and limitations

questions.text: Before implementing a technical solution, you must:
A Service Level ___ (SLA) defines the level of service expected from a vendor.
When providing technical advice to non-technical clients, you should:

answers.text: Use as much technical terminology as possible
Assume they understand basic IT concepts

questions.text: The two main types of technical support are in-house support and ___ support.
What should be provided to clients along with technical training?
The primary purpose of obtaining client feedback is to:
Good feedback questions should be specific, measurable, ___, and brief.

answers.text: Act on every single comment immediately
Look for recurring patterns and prioritize issues

questions.text: After implementing changes based on feedback, you should ___ clients that you've taken action.
Describe the complete process for handling a new client support request, from initial review through to obtaining feedback. Include at least 5 key steps. (6-8 sentences)

Explain why it's important to adjust your communication style based on the client's technical knowledge level. Provide a specific example of how you would explain a network connectivity issue to both a technical and non-technical client. (5-7 sentences)

You've received feedback from multiple clients that your response times are too slow. Describe how you would: 1) Analyze this feedback, 2) Prioritize the issue, 3) Implement changes, and 4) Follow up with clients. (6-8 sentences)
